articles.title: Minju Joson Brands US as Mastermind of Nuclear Proliferation
articles.content:
Minju Joson Brands US as Mastermind of Nuclear Proliferation
Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- Germany's proposal calling for the withdrawal of the U.S. nukes from NATO member countries was supported by Netherlands, Norway, Belgium and Luxemburg in October.
					 Commenting on the fact, a news analyst of Minju Joson, a leading newspaper of the DPRK, says on Sunday:
					
					 This demand growing in Europe reflects the unanimous desire of humankind for prevention of a nuclear war and shows that it is ripe in political and diplomatic aspect for Europe to raise this matter.
					
					 The U.S. moves to keep nukes in European countries are a challenge to the trend of the present times toward disarmament against nuclear war.
					
					 It is the ambition and nuclear strategy of the U.S. to put the world under its domination by holding monopoly over nukes and supremacy in strategic striking weapons.
					
					 To attain this criminal purpose, the U.S. deployed huge nuclear armed forces in strategic vantages of the world. And it spends a large amount of money for the modernization of nuclear weapons every year and steadily poses a nuclear threat to its rivals and "potential enemies" while proliferating nuclear technology to its followers.
					
					 This year alone, the U.S. openly designated the DPRK and other anti-imperialist and independent countries as the targets of its preemptive nuclear attack in its "nuclear posture review."
					
					 The reality goes to clearly prove that the U.S. is chiefly to blame for nuclear threat and proliferation in the world. Serious nuclear arms race and increased danger of nuclear war worldwide are entirely attributable to the U.S. nuclear policy.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Warns of Danger of Japan's Militarism
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Warns of Danger of Japan's Militarism
 Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- Japan, a defeated state in the Second World War, has run the whole gamut of ploy to paint itself as a "pacifist state" but this more strikingly revealed its dirty colors as a war state and aggressor before the international community, says Rodong Sinmun, a major newspaper of the DPRK.
					 In a by-lined article on Sunday the newspaper cites facts to prove that this year Japan has done wrongdoings which can be done only by a war state.
					
					 The DPRK becomes a target of the Japanese reactionaries who are working to turn Japan into a military giant for overseas expansion, the article pointes out.
					
					 The article goes on to say:
					
					 "Their call for 'securing the capability for attack on the enemy's bases' was prompted by Japan's intention for reinvasion. The 'enemy' mentioned by them means the DPRK. The Japanese warmongers' call for 'attack' is just a slogan for staging a comeback to Korea and a prelude to a war."
					
					 "This is well evidenced by the fact that they have been getting hell-bent on the anti-DPRK campaign as soon as an unexpected incident occurred on the Korean Peninsula."
					
					 "The Japanese militarist forces go reckless in a bid to realize their ambition for reinvasion on a war chariot of their American master under the pretext of 'military cooperation.' The involvement of the mobile strike forces of the 'Self-Defense Forces' in the naval joint exercises of the U.S. and south Korea shows how hard they have worked to round off the preparations for reinvasion of Korea this year."
					
					 "The Japanese militarist forces' scheme for reinvasion is put into practice, going beyond the danger line. The existence of a dangerous war state in the vicinity of Korea itself is a serious threat to the DPRK."

articles.title: Korean Exhibition Opened in South Africa
articles.content:
Korean Exhibition Opened in South Africa
						
 Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- A Korean book, photo and handicraft exhibition was opened in Pretoria on Dec. 15 as part of the events of the 17th World Festival of Youth and Students going on in South Africa.
					The exhibits included works of President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, photos of the leader inspecting units of the Korean People's Army, giving field guidance to various domains of the national economy and giving torchlight of the revolution to the young Koreans, picture albums and handicrafts.
					
					 Present at the opening exhibition were youth and student delegations from the DPRK and other countries and representatives of international and regional organizations.
					
					 Congratulatory speeches were made there by the president of the World Federation of Democratic Youth who is coordinator of the international organizing committee of the festival and a co-chairman of the South African national preparatory committee for the festival.
					
					 The participants looked round the exhibition hall and enjoyed an art performance given by the DPRK delegation of youth and students.
					
					 On Dec. 15 and 16 the DPRK delegation took part in meetings and seminars on such themes as "Struggle for peace, sovereignty and solidarity against imperialism", "Struggle of youth in the fields of education, science, culture and information" and "Struggle for peace, role of youth" and a solidarity event for South Africa's day.
					
					 At the meetings and seminars representatives of youth and students from different countries expressed boundless reverence for Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and called for strengthened support and solidarity with the cause of the Korean revolution.

articles.title: Herb-growing Areas Increase
articles.content:
Herb-growing Areas Increase
Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- The DPRK created at least 23,000 hectares of herb-growing areas this year through the drive to increase the medical plants of the country.
					 North Phyongan Province has directed big efforts to creating herb mountainous areas and cultivating medical plants.
					
					 The Unsan County Koryo Medicine Factory increased over 400 more hectares of areas under herb cultivation by concentrating efforts. It also created big profitable herb sites, including 200 odd hectares of hawthorn forest and 100 hectares of aronia melanocarpa        forest.
					
					 The Jongju City Herb Management Agency, too, grows Schizandra chinensis, Amur cork, honey locust and other medical plants on a wide scale.
					
					 Herb cultivation has been vigorously conducted in South Hamgyong Province where herb-producing areas were created everywhere.
					
					 The Kumya County Herb Management Agency realigned at least 170 hectares of wild herb areas to plant many trees of high medicinal value.
					
					 The Pukchong County Herb Management Agency worked out a plan for creating herb mountainous areas in a realistic manner and expanded the areas to over 140 hectares.
					
					 County herb management agencies in Jagang Province plant and cultivate various species of medical plants suited to geographical conditions.

articles.title: S. Koreans Urge Repeal of Military's Projected Shelling
articles.content:
S. Koreans Urge Repeal of Military's Projected Shelling
 Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- Civic and public organizations in south Korea called a press conference in Seoul on December 17 to protest against the warmongers' provocative scheme for shelling.
					 They included the Solidarity for Progress, the Confederation of Trade Unions, the Solidarity for Democracy, People's Life, Peaceful Reunification and Sovereignty and the People for Achieving Peace and Reunification.
					
					 Speakers at the conference said that the military's scheme for shelling in Yonphyong Island is bound to face a severe punishment by the people as it will drive the Korean Peninsula to the flames of war.
					
					 If a military conflict occurs again between the south and the north, it will lead to an overall war rather than a limited warfare, they said, demanding that the Lee Myung Bak "government" stop action of bringing horror of war to the people.
					
					 What the "government" should do is to come out to the south-north dialogue for peace on the peninsula, far from staging the shelling drill which might spark off a military conflict, they said.
					
					 They demanded the prompt repeal of the reckless projected shelling aimed to divert elsewhere the people's anti-"government" sentiment over the railroading of the budget bill for next year at the "National Assembly".

articles.title: Application of Tuition-free Program for Koreans in Japan Urged
articles.content:
Application of Tuition-free Program for Koreans in Japan Urged
 Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- An emergency meeting took place in Japan on Dec. 14 in demand of the application of tuition-waiver program for senior high schools to the Korean schools.
					 Present there were teachers and students of Korean schools, their parents and other Korean residents and Japanese citizens in Osaka Prefecture.
					
					 Speaking at the meeting, Mikiaki Arimoto, co-representative of the Solidarity of Citizens in Osaka Prefecture Demanding Earlier Normalization of the Relations between Japan and DPRK, accused the Japanese government of suspending the procedure for applying the program to the Korean schools under the pretext of the Yonphyong Island shelling in the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 Now is the time for teachers and students of Korean schools and their parents and Japanese citizens in Osaka Prefecture to pool their efforts for the settlement of the program issue, he stressed.
					
					 A report and speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that the Japanese government's exclusion of Korean schools from the program would only raise the consciousness of national discrimination.
					
					 They urged the Japanese government not to deprive the students of their right to learning but immediately apply the program to the Korean schools.
					
					 Written requests addressed to the Japanese prime minister and the governor of Osaka Prefecture were adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Ecuadorians Prepare to Commemorate Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth
articles.content:
Ecuadorians Prepare to Commemorate Centenary of Kim Il Sung's Birth
Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Ecuadorian national preparatory committee for commemorating the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung was held in Quito on Dec. 10.
					 Present there were members of the committee and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the committee's activities for this year and discussed the matter of conducting more diverse and brisk activities on a nationwide scale next year.

articles.title: DPRK Anniversaries Marked Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK Anniversaries Marked Abroad
 Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- Personages of Bangladesh and Italy issued statements on Dec. 13 to mark the 19th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's gaining of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 93rd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero.
					 Hasanul Huq Inu, chairman of the Central Executive Committee of the Bangladesh National Socialist Party, said in a statement that the exploits performed by Kim Jong Suk for national liberation and the building of revolutionary armed forces of Juche type true to the Songun idea of President Kim Il Sung would shine long with the victorious advance of the KPA.
					
					 The KPA has grown to be invincible armed forces under the guidance of Supreme Commander Kim Jong Il, he said. "All victories won by the Korean army and people in showdown with the U.S. and socialist construction are a great encouragement to the progressive mankind."
					
					 Miriam Pelegrini Feri, president of the Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy, said in a statement that the U.S. imperialists would not dare to provoke a new war in Korea. It is because the KPA which has grown to be an invincible army thanks to the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung and the Songun politics of Kim Jong Il is reliably defending the socialist gains and the sovereignty of the country, the president added.

articles.title: Lecture on DPRK Given in Spain
articles.content:
Lecture on DPRK Given in Spain
 Pyongyang, December 19 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain gave a lecture on the DPRK in Spain on Dec. 4.
					 The lecturer noted that brisk activities are going on across the world to commemorate the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung as a great political festival common to humankind.
					
					 He briefed on the undying exploits of Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, the validity of the Songun politics of the Workers' Party of Korea and the true picture of the DPRK where the party, army and people are closely rallied as one around their leader.
					
					 He also cited facts to prove that the U.S. and the south Korean authorities are to blame for the "Cheonan" warship sinking case and the Yonphyong Island incident.
